headline.main: The Pacific Telegraph. INTERESTING DETAILS OF ITS CONSTRUCTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Thanksgiving Day--the 28th ult.--a large party of the workmen engaged in constructing the Pacific Telegraph from the western borders to Salt Lake City, under the direction of Mr. CREIGHTON, arrived at Omaha on their return. Among them was SAMUEL P. STARR, of this city, who reached home on Thursday last.

headline.main: THE MATRICIDE IN FIRST-AVENUE.; HORRIBLE DETAILS. The Prisoner Adjudged to be Insane.

docs.lead_paragraph: Coroner SCHIRMER held an inquest yesterday upon the body of Mrs. McGILL, who came to her death on Sunday, by being thrown out of the fifthstory window of horse No. 292 First-avenue, by her son, THOMAS McGILL. The substantial facts were published in yesterday's TIMES, bnt some of the evidence elicited upon the inquest is worthy of publication.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. WINSLOW, an experienced nurse and female physician, has a Soothing Syrup for children teething which greatly facilitates the process of teething, by softening the gums, reducing all inflammation Will tallay all pain, and his sure to regulate the bowels. Depend upon it, mothers, it will give rest to yourselves and relief and health to your infants. Porfectly safe in all cases.
